author: Rosario3
title: Dos medallas más para Argentina: Paula Gómez logró el bronce en judo y Hernán Urra la plata en lanzamiento de bala
text:
Paula Gómez (J1) venció a la canadiense Priscilla Gagne y se quedó con la medalla de bronce en la categoría -57Kg de los Juegos Paralímpicos París 2024. La judoca nacida en Merlo ganó por acumulación de tres sanciones (shido) de su rival y obtuvo la 9º medalla de Argentina.
"Vengo soñando con esta medalla desde Río", dijo Paula al terminar la última batalla. Y agregó: "Costó un montón, pero lo logramos. Yo subí al Tatami, pero hay mucha gente detrás de esta medalla. No voy a dejar de agradecerles nunca".
"MI MAYOR FORTALEZA ES LA PERSEVERANCIA"����— ParaDeportes (@ParaDeportesOK)
Con la Torre Eiffel de fondo, Paula Gómez habló con Paradeportes:
"Me caí y levanté un montón de veces. Me enojé, me frustre y lloré, la pasé mal; gracias a la confianza que me dieron hoy estoy acá. Hoy es el día más feliz de mi vida".
[pic.twitter.com/y1XiBWAMvj] [September 5, 2024]
"Me caí y levanté un montón de veces. Me enojé, me frustré y lloré, la pasé mal; gracias a la confianza que me dieron hoy estoy acá. Hoy es el día más feliz de mi vida".
Las dos últimas medallas en judo habían sido en Londres 2012 con José David Effron y Jorge Lencina. Doce años después, Argentina vuelve a tener medalla en esa disciplina.
Llegó la décima en París
Hernán Urra volvió a subirse al podio paralímpico: en París, logró la medalla plateada en lanzamiento de bala (T35) con una marca de 16.11 metros.
El oriundo de Cinco Saltos (Río Negro) sumó así su tercera plata consecutiva. Al igual que en Río y en Tokio, se volvió a subir al podio. Por si fuera poco, logró el récord panamericano.
Además, le propuso casamiento a su pareja. ¿Le dirán que sí?
¡Hernán Urra ya compite en la final de lanzamiento de bala T35 en el Stade de France!— ParaDeportes (@ParaDeportesOK)
[#LosParaEnParadeportes] [#JuegosParalimpicos2024] [#Paris2024] [#Argentina] [#ParaAthletics] [pic.twitter.com/F099wLMjNn] [September 5, 2024]

author: CNN Espanol
title: Papa Francisco insta a las partes en la guerra en Ucrania a negociar
text:
El Universal Papa Francisco insta a las partes en la guerra en Ucrania a negociar El Universal 9 de marzo de 2024, 1:34 p. m. · 3 min de lectura
CIUDAD DE MÉXICO, marzo 9 (EL UNIVERSAL).- El papa Francisco instó a las partes involucradas en la guerra en Ucrania "a no avergonzarse de negociar antes de que las cosas empeoren".
El líder religioso concedió una entrevista a Radio Televisión Suisse (RTS), una emisora pública suiza que transmite en francés, parte de la cual fue difundida este sábado, reportó Vatican News.
El Papa ofreció su opinión, en la entrevista que saldrá al aire en la televisión suiza el 20 de marzo, sobre las guerras que manchan el mundo, especialmente la de Rusia en Ucrania y la de entre Israel y Hamas en Gaza.
Según lo difundido, todos los días a las 7 de la tarde, el jerarca católico llama por teléfono a la parroquia de la Sagrada Familia en Gaza, donde se refugian 600 personas.
"Me cuentan lo que están presenciando", dijo. "Es una guerra. Y para hacer la guerra se necesitan dos, no sólo uno. Los irresponsables son estos dos que hacen la guerra".
También lamentó la "guerra de guerrillas" emprendida por Hamas y calificó la guerra como "algo terrible".
"Las negociaciones nunca son una rendición"
"Las negociaciones nunca son una rendición", dijo. "Es el coraje de no llevar a un país al suicidio".
Hablando de las conversaciones de paz, el papa Francisco instó a las partes en la guerra en Ucrania a "no avergonzarse de negociar antes de que las cosas empeoren".
Señaló que las negociaciones también se pueden llevar a cabo con la ayuda de "potencias internacionales".
"La palabra 'negociar' es una palabra valiente", dijo. "Cuando uno ve que está derrotado, que las cosas no van bien, hay que tener el coraje de negociar. Quizás te sientas avergonzado, pero ¿con cuántas muertes terminará? Negociar a tiempo; buscar algún país que pueda mediar. Hoy, por ejemplo, en la guerra de Ucrania, hay muchos que quieren mediar. Turquía se ha ofrecido a ello. Y otros. No te avergüences de negociar antes de que las cosas empeoren".
Continuar leyendo la historia "Un niño que no sabe sonreír no parece tener futuro"
"Hay una imagen que siempre me viene a la mente", dijo en la entrevista de la televisión suiza. "Con motivo de una conmemoración en la que tuve que hablar de paz y soltar dos palomas, la primera vez que lo hice, inmediatamente se levantó un cuervo presente en la Plaza de San Pedro, agarró la paloma y se la llevó. Es duro. Y esto es en cierto modo lo que sucede con la guerra. Mucha gente inocente no puede crecer, muchos niños no tienen futuro".
Muchos niños ucranianos vienen a saludarlo, añadió el Papa, lamentando haber perdido la capacidad de sonreír. "Un niño que no sabe sonreír no parece tener futuro", afirmó. "La guerra es siempre una derrota: una derrota humana, no geográfica".
Señaló que siempre hay situaciones geográficas o históricas que provocan una guerra, lo que lleva a la conclusión de que la guerra "parece simplemente basada en motivos prácticos".
"Pero detrás de cada guerra", añadió, "está la industria armamentista, y esto significa dinero".
La guerra, dijo el papa Francisco, "es oscuridad, el poder de las tinieblas".
MÁS POPULARES Así van las encuestas en México cuando faltan tres meses para las elecciones presidenciales CNN Espanol · 5 min de lectura Anthony Joshua destroza los sueños del Depredador con un nocaut de terror en Arabia Saudita El Nuevo Herald · 2 min de lectura Abuso en Vélez: la abogada de la joven contó que quedó “ensangrentada” y reveló la frase de uno de los jugadores LA NACION · 4 min de lectura Fórmula 1: voló Verstappen en Arabia Saudita y el nuevo chico de oro fue elegido “piloto del día” LA NACION · 5 min de lectura Detiene a otro hombre con 700 mil pesos que no pudo acreditar El Universal · 1 min de lectura

author: Luigi Civalli
title: Ticiane Pinheiro chora antes da festa de 15 anos de Rafa Justus
text: Ticiane Pinheiro chora no dia dos 15 anos de Rafa Justus: ‘Ansiosa’ Por [Luigi Civalli](https://ofuxico.com.br/author/luigi/) - 30/08/24 às 11:24 A aguardada festa de 15 anos de Rafaella Justus será realizada nesta sexta-feira, 30 de agosto, e o clima de emoção já tomou conta da família. Ticiane Pinheiro começou o dia muito emocionada. Mesmo com os preparativos a todo vapor, a apresentadora não escondeu as lágrimas. Dentro do carro, a caminho da Record, a apresentadora disse que já chorou muito desde que acordou. “Chegou o grande dia, e eu só choro. Estou indo para o trabalho, hoje eu ia folgar, mas a Renatinha (Renata Alves) quebrou a mão, então estou indo para a Record. Só choro, não sei como vai ser esse programa hoje, não. Estou muito emocionada, ao mesmo tempo fico ansiosa, torcendo para dar tudo certo”, revelou a apresentadora do Hoje em Dia. [Ticiane Pinheiro mostra docinhos de festa de 15 anos de Rafa Justus](https://ofuxico.com.br/noticias/ticiane-pinheiro-mostra-docinhos-de-festa-de-15-anos-de-rafa-justus/) Fabiana Justus não vai à festa Outro momento de emoção para Ticiane foi a conversa com Fabiana Justus, irmã mais velha de Rafaella. A empresária não poderá comparecer à festa por estar em tratamento contra o câncer, o que a impede de participar de eventos com grande aglomeração devido à baixa imunidade. “Estava agora falando com a Fabi, queria muito que ela estivesse com a gente nesse dia tão especial, fiquei emocionada também”, desabafou Ticiane. Apesar das lágrimas, a apresentadora destacou a felicidade de proporcionar essa celebração para sua filha. “Quinze anos já, muito legal a gente poder proporcionar essa festa para ela. Ela está muito feliz, está ansiosa também. Vai dar tudo certo, espero aguentar a noite toda. Estou cansada, ontem fiquei com a Rafa que estava tão ansiosa que não conseguia dormir”, finalizou. [Receba as Notícias de OFuxico em seu celular](https://chat.whatsapp.com/FnDWEihz4meDvhNL3hsfMi) Nos vídeos seguintes, Ticiane Pinheiro já apareceu toda maquiada, pronta para entrar no estúdio do programa. “Olha o que uma maquiagem não faz. Pra animar, coloquei umas músicas de balada, uns funks, uns sertanejos”. [Luigi Civalli](https://ofuxico.com.br/author/luigi/) Formado desde 2010, já passou pelas editorias de esporte e entretenimento em outros veículos do país e atualmente está no OFuxico. Produz matérias, reportagens, coberturas de eventos, apresenta lives e ainda faz vídeos curtos para as redes sociais

author: Robert Duff
title: Oregon State vs Notre Dame Prediction, Preview & Odds – Sun Bowl 2023
text: Oregon State vs Notre Dame Prediction, Preview & Odds – Sun Bowl 2023 - The #15 Notre Dame Fighting Irish are 6-point favorites over the #21 Oregon State Beavers in the Sun Bowl on Friday, December 29 - Oregon State is 1-4 ATS in the school’s past five games - Notre Dame is 4-1 SU and ATS over its last five games The #15 Notre Dame Fighting Irish (9-3, 8-3-1 ATS) and the Oregon Beavers (8-4, 6-6 ATS) have a bowl game history. It’s not gone well for the Irish. Both prior meetings between these two schools came in bowl game appearances. Oregon State beat Notre 38-21 in the 2004 Insight Bowl. Three years earlier, the Beavers whipped the Irish 41-9 in the Fiesta Bowl. Recent history is of more interest to oddsmakers, who’ve set the Irish as 6-point favorites in the [Oregon State vs Notre Dame odds](https://www.sportsbettingdime.com/college-football/odds/matchup/adc0d747-3a5b-495d-928e-588bd0b8774e/). The Irish are 0-1-1 ATS in those two previous clashes with the Beavers. Let’s look more deeply look into this Oregon State vs Notre Dame matchup and offer you our pick for this NCAA football bowl game. Oregon State vs Notre Dame Odds |Team||Moneyline||Spread||Total| |Oregon State Beavers||+190||+6 (-110)||Over 41.5 (-110)| |Notre Dame Fighting Irish||-225||-6 (-110)||Under 41.5 (-110)| In the Oregon State vs Notre Dame odds, the Irish are -225 moneyline favorites, giving them a 69.23% implied win probability. The total is set at 41.5 points. Four of Oregon State’s last five games have gone under. Bet Anything and Get $250! Must manually enter promo code DIME to claim offer. [LOCK IN PROMO] DIME [GET OFFER NOW](https://www.sportsbettingdime.com/go/espn-bet/) Odds as of Dec. 28 at ESPN BET. Check out our [ESPN BET promo](https://www.sportsbettingdime.com/sportsbooks/espn-bet/promos/) before betting on Beavers vs Irish and other college football bowl game action. And don’t forget to input the promo code “DIME” when signing up at ESPN BET to get your $250 in bonus bets. The Beavers are 10-7 SU all-time in bowl game appearances. That includes a 3-0 win over Pitt in the 2008 Sun Bowl. Notre Dame’s bowl game history stretches back to the 1925 Rose Bowl. The Irish are 20-21 SU in 41 appearances. Notre Dame beat Miami (Fla) 33-17 in the 2010 Sun Bowl. Kickoff for this game at Sun Bowl Stadium on Friday, December 29 is set for 2:00 pm ET. The broadcast is being carried by CBS. Beavers vs Fighting Irish Betting Trends There’s definite uncertainty about this game and that’s spilling over into the [college football public betting](https://www.sportsbettingdime.com/college-football/public-betting-trends/) splits. Spread bettors are loving the underdog Beavers, while moneyline players are going all-in on the favored Irish. Oregon State is drawing 51% of handle and 65% of bets in the spread splits. This even though the Beavers are 1-4 ATS in their past five games. Notre Dame, 4-1 SU over the last five games, are pulling 100% of handle and 97% of bets in the moneyline splits. Surprisingly, in a game that will be featuring so many new players in key roles, the over is drawing massive support from the people. It’s getting 94% of handle and 97% of bets in the total action. Angeli To Lead Irish Even though they’ll be missing their QB1, the Irish are still the Sun Bowl chalk. Sam Hartman is [opting out](https://www.sportsbettingdime.com/news/ncaaf/2023-college-football-bowl-game-opt-outs-tracker-players-sitting-out-bowls/) of the game to prepare for the NFL Draft. In one season at Notre Dame, the Wake Forest transfer threw for 2,689 yards and 24 touchdowns against eight interceptions. Under center for Notre Dame against Oregon State will be sophomore Steve Angeli. In a mop-up role behind Hartman, Angeli has completed 19 of 25 passes for 272 yards and four touchdowns, while tossing one interception. If Angeli struggles to move the Irish offense, don’t be surprised if Notre Dame hands over the reins of the offense to freshman Kenny Minchey. Marcus Freeman's message to his Sun Bowl starting QB: "You have to be Steve Angeli. Don’t be Sam Hartman. Don’t be anybody else. Be Steve Angeli." [#NDFootball] [#NotreDame] — Mike BerardinoNDI (@MikeBerardino) [December 28, 2023] Two key starters along the OL, LT Joe Alt and RT Blake Fisher, are skipping the game to get ready for the NFL Draft. They’re among 13 Notre Dame players who’ve decided not to suit up. Notre Dame will also be minus offensive coordinator Gerad Parker. He left to accept the head coaching position at Troy. Coaching Change For Beavers Change is also afoot at Oregon State. Head coach Jonathan Smith departed to accept the Michigan State job. Receivers coach Kefense Hynson will be serving as interim head coach for this game. The Beavers will also be turning to their backup QB, albeit a second-stringer with significant first-string experience. With QB1 DJ Uiagalelei entering the transfer portal, Ben Gulbranson will be under center. The last time Ben Gulbranson started a Bowl Game for the Beaver!!! [#GoBeavs] [pic.twitter.com/VrGyTRkpRf] — Sidelines – Oregon State (@SSN_Beavers) [December 4, 2023] Gulbranson was 7-1 SU as Oregon State’s starter last season. He would be named MVP of the Las Vegas Bowl. Five other Beavers are opting out of this game. Protecting Angeli could prove an issue for Notre Dame minus both Irish starting tackles. Oregon State’s defense is tied for ninth in the nation with 36 sacks. Oregon State vs Notre Dame Prediction Considering the disarray and uncertainty on both sides of the football in this game, the best bet here is to go low. Fade the public and take the under on the total of 41.5 points. Remember, Oregon State’s only previous Sun Bowl appearance was a 3-0 victory. Oregon State vs Notre Dame Pick: Under 41.5 points (-110)

author: Ubah Ali
title: Team that recovers items that fall through lake ice sees increase in calls during warm winter - CBS Minnesota
text:
DETROIT LAKES, Minn. — Our warm winter is creating dangerous conditions on our lakes, no matter how far north you go.
Many of the ice houses that were already set up are going down.
It's keeping a specialized team of Minnesotans busy.
Tri-State Diving in Detroit Lakes deep dive to bring back what's been lost or fallen through the ice. Gary Thompson and his team are folks that pull it back up.
RELATED: December 2023 is tracking to be warmest on record in Minnesota
"Right now, I'm telling people if you have a fish house on the lake, get it off it's going to end up down," Thompson said.
The lack of ice triggered a new state-wide warning from the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources.
"It'll take a while several consecutive days for the ice to form a new clear layer underneath and people need to wait and be patient for that," said Nicole Biagi, Department of Natural Resources, Ice Safety Coordinator.
It has caused some bizarre scenes across our 10,000 lakes: A plane sticking out of Upper Red Lake or an after-Christmas water skier in Maple Grove.
Thompson sighed heavily and said it's not a normal year.
During a normal winter, he says they do about one recovery a week.
"Since Christmas Eve, I've had 13 calls come in and recover," Thompson said.
Last week, his team went out to Crystal Lake where a 4-wheeler plunged in. In Little Cormorant Lake near Detroit Lakes, a fish house broke through the ice.
READ MORE: Lack of snow, ice partially to blame for warmer winter temperatures in Minnesota
"We put sleds on the wheels of the fish house and rolled it onto shore," Thompson said. "We pull it for 500 yards to get it out."
Ice conditions can also be dangerous for experts. Thompson said during a recovery Wednesday, his team could see the ice cracking around them.
The lack of ice is changing how many Minnesotans enjoy the winter outdoors.

author: Alexandra Skores
title: GasBuddy sees gas prices dropping 13 cents a gallon across the U.S. next year
text:
Your buck is likely to take you on a little farther road trip next year. At least that’s the outlook from Patrick De Haan , GasBuddy’s head of petroleum analysis and one of the most cited experts on gasoline prices.
Advertisement De Haan is predicting a 13 cents a gallon drop in regular unleaded gas prices nationwide next year, along with the usual seasonal ups and downs seen every spring and summer. His 2023 prediction fell short by only 2 cents — $3.49 a gallon versus $3.51 in actuality.
Advertisement “Those seasonal trends are very well established,” he said. “But all in all, we expect a modest improvement.”

author: Poteau Daily News
title: ACIBADEM Healthcare Group Unveils Comprehensive Product Update with Enhanced Telemedicine and Specialized Healthcare Services | User | poteaudailynews.com
text:
ACIBADEM Healthcare Group has launched expanded services focused on telemedicine and digital solutions, enhancing patient access to specialized care in cardiology, oncology, and neurology. The initiative includes 24/7 access to medical specialists, comprehensive care plans, and seamless support for international patients, ensuring personalized healthcare experiences.
Istanbul, Turkey - October 17, 2024 —
ACIBADEM Health care Group is thrilled to announce the launch of expanded services that significantly enhance patient access to world-class healthcare, with a renewed focus on telemedicine and digital healthcare solutions. This substantial product update makes it easier for both local and international patients to receive high-quality medical care from the comfort of their homes or while on the go. By integrating advanced technology with exceptional clinical expertise, ACIBADEM is redefining how healthcare is delivered and experienced.
The latest enhancements are anchored by the introduction of specialized centers dedicated to cardiology, oncology, and neurology. These centers leverage state-of-the-art medical technologies and innovative treatment modalities, ensuring that patients have access to cutting-edge care tailored specifically to their health needs. With a multidisciplinary team of experts on hand, ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is committed to empowering patients with comprehensive treatment options that fit their individual circumstances and health goals.
As part of this product update, ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is introducing an advanced digital platform that provides patients with 24/7 access to medical specialists. This means that whether it is routine inquiries, urgent care needs or ongoing treatment management, patients can easily connect with professionals who are dedicated to their care. The convenience of telemedicine is complemented by personalized care coordinators who can guide patients through complex healthcare decisions, ensuring that every patient feels supported throughout their healthcare journey.
One of the standout features of this update is what ACIBADEM refers to as "comprehensive care plans." These plans are meticulously designed around each patient’s unique healthcare needs and preferences. This patient-centric approach is enhanced by international patient services that provide seamless logistical support for those traveling to receive care. This includes multilingual staff who are fluent in numerous languages and are trained to assist patients in navigating their experiences at ACIBADEM's network of facilities.
For international patients, the experience is further enriched by seamless medical travel assistance services that address every aspect of a patient's visit, from initial consultations to postoperative care and follow-up appointments. This ensures a convenient, stress-free experience, allowing patients to focus on their well-being while receiving treatment from one of the world’s leading healthcare providers. ACIBADEM’s commitment to providing personalized care extends beyond just treatment; it aims to cultivate a compassionate and understanding environment for all patients.
As a prominent healthcare provider operating a robust network of hospitals and clinics across five countries, including 40 hospitals worldwide, ACIBADEM Health care Group has positioned itself as a leader in comprehensive healthcare services. With over 25,000 dedicated employees, the organization boasts a wealth of expertise and resources aimed at delivering unparalleled healthcare experiences tailored to meet the diverse needs of patients globally. ACIBADEM is dedicated to ensuring excellence in patient care, aligning with international healthcare standards that exemplify quality and safety.
In today’s fast-paced world, having access to swift medical assistance is more crucial than ever. The integration of telemedicine into ACIBADEM's healthcare framework not only enhances patient access but also streamlines the clinical workflow, allowing for quicker diagnosis and treatment initiation. This adaptation to modern healthcare demands positions ACIBADEM as a forward-thinking organization that embodies the future of healthcare delivery – one that harmonizes in-person care with the countless conveniences of digital solutions.
In addition to the enhanced digital platforms and specialized centers, ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is continuously investing in further advancements and research to extend its services. Collaboration with leaders in medical technology and innovation aims to integrate artificial intelligence, telehealth monitoring, and novel treatment modalities into everyday practice. This commitment to evolving with the healthcare landscape allows ACIBADEM to offer patients the latest care techniques and interventions, ensuring they receive effective and timely treatment.
The overarching mission of ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is to create a healthcare environment where every patient receives the best possible care. As part of this commitment to healthcare excellence, the organization actively pursues feedback from patients and ongoing collaborations with healthcare professionals to refine and enhance services continuously. ACIBADEM welcomes the opportunity to serve individuals from all walks of life, recognizing that every patient’s health journey is unique and deserving of individualized attention and effort.
In summary, the product update rolled out by ACIBADEM Healthcare Group includes an impressive array of expanded services focusing on telemedicine and digital healthcare solutions along with specialized medical centers. This initiative improves the accessibility and quality of healthcare while guaranteeing a personalized experience for every patient. With responsibilities to patients stretching beyond clinical care, ACIBADEM remains devoted to achieving the highest standards of healthcare excellence on a global scale, fostering a community where patients can trust they are receiving unparalleled care.
As ACIBADEM Health care Group embarks on this new chapter in its service offering, it invites current and prospective patients to explore the unprecedented healthcare solutions available, ensuring that quality care is always just a click away. The commitment to healthcare excellence, unwavering compassion, and innovative approaches to treatment remains at the core of ACIBADEM's philosophy, defining what it means to prioritize the health and wellness of every individual served

author: Rick Hurd
title: Second storm of the week remains on track to hit Bay Area and is expected to bring dangerous winds
text: The second storm system of the week to descend upon the Bay Area remained on track to hit the region by early Saturday, according to the National Weather Service. a prediction that has been expected since the start of the week. But on Friday, forecasters added a new element to the forecast: Offshore winds will be more powerful than initially anticipated and may persist past Sunday, possibly into early next week, according to the weather service. Those winds blowing toward the ocean may dry out quickly whatever rain does fall. It’s a scenario that could create fire danger as the weekend fades. “Right now, we’re concerned as we move from Sunday into Monday,” NWS meteorologist Crystal Oudit said early Friday. “There will be offshore winds in the hills. The beneficial thing is that we will be getting rain for a good part of Saturday. But when those winds blow toward the ocean, it creates very dry conditions quickly after the rain stops.” Wind gusts are expected to blow as high 30 mph in most places in the region on Sunday, and they may get as high as 40 mph in the higher elevations, according to the weather service. Oudit said the weather service has not issued any advisory or warnings but that the status of that could change before Monday. The rain from the system is expected to bring at least a quarter-inch of precipitation to the region, with some higher elevations in line to get as much as a half-inch. The system is moving down from the northern Pacific Ocean and will keep the temperatures chilly. It also is expected to bring more snow to the Sierra Nevada. Forecasters said they are uncertain about how much will fall, predicting an amount between six inches in the lower elevations to two feet in the higher areas. The rain and snow are expected to be finished by Saturday night. A weather winter advisory for the Sierra Nevada is in effect from 5 p.m. Friday until 11 a.m. Saturday. “We anticipate it’s going to taper off by mid-day Saturday,” Oudit said of the Bay Area rain. “Then it’s a matter of how quickly everything dries up.”

author: spud101
title: Avisynth+ stuck on previous error message
text:
I have a strange problem where
[Avisynth]+ was working fine then I opened an older script in AvsPod which used Deen & received "cannot load a 32bit DLL in 64 bit Avisynth Deen.dll" error message.
Now I get that same error message everytime I try to open any script in Avisynth.
My current script is 1 line...
FFmpegSource2("c:\temp\cowboy.mp4") and I still get "cannot load a 32bit DLL in 64 bit Avisynth Deen.dll" error message.
If it try to open the script in
[Virtualdub]..I also get the same error. Tried rebooting....still the same
Any idea what's happening here & how I can clear it?
Thanks
[+ Reply to Thread](newreply.php?p=2748622&noquote=1)
Results 1 to 3 of 3
Thread
-
-
Avs+ is trying to autoload the x86 Deen.dll from the x64 plugins folder.
Delete the .dll , or move it to another folder
-
Yes. thank you.

author: ABC News
title: Workers in New England states looking forward to a bump up in minimum wages in 2024 - ABC News
text: Workers in New England states looking forward to a bump up in minimum wages in 2024 Workers in several New England states are looking forward to a bump up in the minimum wage in 2024 while advocates in Massachusetts are pushing a ballot question aimed at phasing out the state’s subminimum wage for tipped workers BOSTON -- Workers in several New England states are looking forward to a bump up in the minimum wage in 2024 while advocates in Massachusetts are pushing a ballot question aimed at phasing out the state's subminimum wage of $6.75 per hour for tipped workers. In Rhode Island, the state's current $13 minimum wage will jump by $1 to $14 an hour on Jan. 1. It is the next step in a phased-in increase that will reach $15 in 2025. In Vermont, the state’s minimum wage will reach $13.67 — climbing $0.49 from the current $13.18 wage. The annual adjustment also affects the minimum wage for tipped workers, which will tick up from $6.59 to $6.84 per hour. Maine will see its hourly minimum wage tick up from $13.80 to $14.15 per hour. Maine requires annual adjustments to the minimum wage based on the cost-of-living. Portland is pushing its city minimum wage from $14 to $15. The state's new tipped wage in 2024 will be $7.08 per hour. The minimum wage in Connecticut will rise from the current rate of $15.00 per hour to $15.69 — the highest in New England. Beginning Jan. 1, and occurring annually each following Jan. 1, the wage will be adjusted according to the U.S. Department of Labor’s calculation of the employment cost index. Massachusetts' minimum wage will remain at $15 per hour in 2024, although there is a campaign to hike the wage again to $20. New Hampshire continues to have the lowest minimum wage in New England, matching the federal wage of $7.25. State lawmakers have defeated multiple attempts to increase it in recent years. The New England states are among 20 raising minimum wages for workers, further widening the gap between state requirements and the federal minimum wage, which has been static at $7.25 an hour since July 2009. In several states, the new minimum will more than double that rate. In Massachusetts, advocates are pushing a ballot question that would phase out the state’s “service rate” which lets restaurants pay workers $6.75 an hour if tips make up the difference between that and the state's $15 minimum wage. Under the question, the service rate would end by 2029. Organizers for the group One Fair Wage said they have collected enough signatures to clear an initial hurdle to gaining a slot on next year's ballot. "Massachusetts voters are ready to move away from outdated wage practices and towards a system that guarantees dignity, justice, and economic security for all workers," Saru Jayaraman, president of One Fair Wage, said in a written statement, The Massachusetts Restaurant Association opposes the question, saying the highest-paid employees in any restaurant are tipped employees, frequently averaging $20, $30, and sometimes even $50 per hour. A restaurant owner can employ more than two full time waitstaff employees for the same hourly rate as one minimum wage employee, said Jessica Muradian of Massachusetts Restaurant Association. “This is a win for the tipped employee because they are the highest compensated employee in the restaurant, it’s a win for the guest who is getting a full-service experience and a win for the restaurant operator who gets to employ as many people as possible,” she said in a statement. The U.S. Department of Labor in August has also announced a proposed rule that would let 3.6 million more workers qualify for overtime. The proposed regulation would require employers to pay overtime to salaried workers who are in executive, administrative and professional roles but make less than $1,059 a week, or $55,068 a year for full-time employees. That salary threshold is up from $35,568.
